tatami.core.util.logging

Class Log

  • java.lang.Object
    • tatami.core.util.logging.Log

  • public class Log
extends java.lang.Object
    Implements a log, based on a log4j log. The idea is to have a standard log4j Logger, but with some additional features, that are accessible via static functions of this class, using the Logger object itself as a unique reference.

    There are currently three possible destinations for the logging information: the console output is standard; an optional TextArea may be specified to be updated with the contents of the log; a Log.ReportingEntity may be specified that will be updated with the logging information.

    A new log is obtained by getLogger(unitName), where unitName should be unique and is the name of the log.

    Other constructors are available, specifying a TextArea and / or a Log.ReportingEntity.

    Using the constructor(s) that contain the 'link' parameter, the log is linked to another log (its 'parent') and when the parent closes, the children close too.

    When a log is not needed any more, one should _always_ call exitLogger() for the that log. (Except if a parent has been given, and it is certain that the log will be closed by its parent)

    Author:
    Andrei Olaru

      • defaultLoggerWrapper

      • AWESOME_SEPARATOR

        public static java.lang.Character AWESOME_SEPARATOR

      • logs

        protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,Log> logs
        Contains all the currently active logs, identified by their [unit]Name. Active means that a timer is associated with them. All access to the logs field should be synchronized explicitly.

      • parents

        protected static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> parents
        All access to parents should be synchronized. In this source, all accesses take place inside locks on the logs field.

      • logger

        protected Logger logger
        The logger that is being wrapped by the instance.

        The logger implementation. Indicates the wrapper to use.

      • logOutput

        protected java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream logOutput
        Contains the entire output of the log. Version without time stamps and unit name, just level and message.

      • logOutputStamped

        protected java.io.ByteArrayOutputStream logOutputStamped
        Contains the entire output of the log. Version with time stamp, level, unit name, and message.

      • logSize

        used to trace if there have been modifications to the log, before flushing it into the TextArea.

    • Method Detail

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String link,
               Log.DisplayEntity display,
               Log.ReportingEntity reporter,
               boolean ensureNew,
               Logger.LoggerType loggerType)
        Provides a logger with the given name. If the name is already in use (and ensureNew is false), the log corresponding to that name will be returned and all other parameters will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        name - : is the name of the associated unit, and of the log. Should be not null unique among active logs. Use Unit.DEFAULT_UNIT_NAME for the default.
        link - : the name of another, 'parent', log that this log is linked to; when the other log will close, this will be closed as well.
        textArea - : a TextArea that will be updated with the contents of the log.
        loggerType - : the Logger class to instantiate. If null, one of them is chosen by default.
        Returns:
        A new, configured, Logger object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - : if the name is not new and ensureNew was set to true.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name,
               java.lang.String link)
        Provides a logger with the given name. If the name is already in use, the log corresponding to that name will be returned and all other parameters will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        name - : is the name of the associated unit, and of the log. Should be unique among active logs.
        link - : the name of another, 'parent', log that this log is linked to; when the other log will close, this will be closed as well.
        Returns:
        A new, configured, Logger object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - : if the name already exists for an active log.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Provides a logger with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - : is the name of the associated unit, and of the log. Should be unique among active logs.
        Returns:
        A new, configured, Logger object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - : if the name already exists for an active log.

      • getLogger

        public static Logger getLogger(java.lang.String name,
               Log.DisplayEntity display)
        Provides a logger with the given name. If the name is already in use, the log corresponding to that name will be returned and all other parameters will be ignored.
        Parameters:
        name - : is the name of the associated unit, and of the log. Should be unique among active logs.
        textArea - : a TextArea that will be updated with the contents of the log.
        Returns:
        A new, configured, Logger object.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - : if the name already exists for an active log.

      • getLoggerOutput

        public static java.lang.String getLoggerOutput(java.lang.String name,
                               boolean shortOutput)
        Get the whole output of the log.
        Parameters:
        name - : the name of the log. If within a normal Unit, probably the return value of getName().
        shortOutput - : if true, the output does not contain the agent name and time stamps (just the level and message).
        Returns:
        the entire contents of the log.

      • exitLogger

        public static void exitLogger(java.lang.String name)
        Closes the log specified by the name (stops the associated timer) and frees the name so it can be reused. The log with not be flushed (sent as report) before closing.
        Parameters:
        name - : the name of the log to be freed. If within a normal Unit, probably the return value of getName().

      • exitLogger

        public static void exitLogger(java.lang.String name,
              boolean flushFirst)
        Closes the log specified by the name (stops the associated timer) and frees the name so it can be reused.
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the log to be freed. If within a normal Unit, probably the return value of getName().

      • resetLogging

        public static void resetLogging()
        Resets the maps containing the links to the logs.

        SHOULD BE USED WITH EXTREME CAUTION and only in special cases where the application is reset without closing it (e.g. on Android).

        FIXME: better do without;
